page.title: 04AIRYHALL PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Airyhall school opened in 1964 and there are now 226 pupils, 114 boys and 112 girls. There are ten permanent teachers and 5 visiting specialists. There is a secretary, a janitor and 3 cleaners. They have a stage, hall, gymnasium, medical room, library and 8 classrooms. The pupils range from 7 to 12 years. One third of the pupils walk to school and the rest arrive by car. Half take school lunches, 60 take packed lunches and the rest go home. Their football team have won a trophy this year. Other trophies won this year include Scottish country dancing, cricket, badminton and choir. At the moment they have four computers but are hoping for more. When the P7 class leaves, they mostly transfer to Hazlehead Academy
